up, Jared?

How cool.

Like what you're kind of responsible for, understand how you're providing success support today, you know, within the business then we can jump into product demo and then just save some time at the end for any questions?
Okay.
Sweet.
Okay.
So I'm over success and support chat and email only.
We have high volume.
We've got like 50,000 paying accounts and we have free accounts and they support all that.
So as of today, we don't have a phone line for support, but we do support everyoneâ€¦ and they're you know, reactive more technical bug fixes, things like that.
They're getting things and passing it to other teams like customer success, account management for an upgrade, things like that.

And then success is we have an onboarding team that's just us training trainings for our volume and then long term CSM that we'll have that gets assigned to actually every account, which we're probably going to change today.
We, we prioritize the bigger accounts, the bigger segments, things like that.
But we do assign a CSM to everything.
So we're talking about doing more of a pooled model for the smaller accounts.

And that's something that's I'm actually intrigued by with AI too to see if there's something that could help us out with that, where this pooled account thing would live somewhere between support and success as it is today.
But so, yeah, we do trainings for people that always helps a lot with retention numbers.
But we're looking at upgrades, downgrades, churn things like that.
Okay.
And would love to understand.
Are you using Gmail or outlook from like an email client today?
Gmail, yep?
And are you using Google group shared mailboxes that you're leveraging internally as an organization kind of like catch all type emails that are on the website?
We have some, yeah, we have, I mean we've got support we've got so that one's used most and we have a sales email.
We have a success email.
We have a there's even like a billing email, but that's more of a fallback.
We don't really rely on it today as much.
But yeah, if we did a pooled model, we would probably do that.
Yeah, maybe I don't know.

What are like the different ways that people are going about it?
So they can go into our app.
We use intercom.
Yeah.
And then there's the AI agent add on that we use.
It's.

We are living in that workspace to provide those success and service capabilities.
And we, you know, were launched in 2017, have over 27,000,000 in funding to date and 2000 customers across the world paid.
And we're pretty agnostic in terms of who we can work with.
So we work with, you know, logistics companies, sales, companies, health care clients, we're iso soc, two hipaa compliant.

Is where we're going to set up hiver as a platform.
